verses.verse: When thou goest forth<WH3318> to battle<WH4421> against thine enemies<WH341>, and seest<WH7200> horses<WH5483>, and chariots<WH7393>, and a people<WH5971> more<WH7227> than thou<WH3372>, thou shalt not be afraid of them<WH3068>; for Jehovah thy God<WH430> is with thee<WH5927>, who brought thee up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.
And it shall be<WH7126>, when ye draw nigh unto the battle<WH4421>, that the priest<WH3548> shall approach<WH5066> and speak<WH1696> unto the people<WH5971>,

and shall say<WH559> unto them<WH8085>, Hear, O Israel<WH3478>, ye draw nigh<WH7131> this day<WH3117> unto battle<WH4421> against your enemies<WH341>: let not your heart<WH3824> faint<WH7401>; fear<WH3372> not<WH2648>, nor tremble, neither be ye affrighted<WH6206> at them<WH6440>;
for Jehovah<WH3068> your God<WH430> is he that goeth<WH1980> with you<WH3898>, to fight for you against your enemies<WH341>, to save you<WH3467>.

And the officers<WH7860> shall speak<WH1696> unto the people<WH5971>, saying<WH559>, What man<WH376> is there that hath built<WH1129> a new<WH2319> house<WH1004>, and hath not dedicated<WH2596> it<WH3212>? let him go and return<WH7725> to his house<WH1004>, lest he die<WH4191> in the battle<WH4421>, and another<WH312> man<WH376> dedicate it<WH2596>.

And what man<WH376> is there that hath planted<WH5193> a vineyard<WH3754>, and hath not used<WH2490> the fruit thereof<WH3212>? let him go and return<WH7725> unto his house<WH1004>, lest he die<WH4191> in the battle<WH4421>, and another<WH312> man<WH376> use the fruit thereof<WH2490>.

And what man<WH376> is there that hath betrothed<WH781> a wife<WH802>, and hath not taken<WH3947> her<WH3212>? let him go and return<WH7725> unto his house<WH1004>, lest he die<WH4191> in the battle<WH4421>, and another<WH312> man<WH376> take her<WH3947>.

And the officers<WH7860> shall speak<WH1696> further<WH3254> unto the people<WH5971>, and they shall say<WH559>, What man<WH376> is there that is fearful<WH3373> and faint-hearted<WH7390>? let him go<WH3212> and return<WH7725> unto his house<WH1004>, lest his brethren<WH251>'s heart<WH3824> melt<WH4549> as his heart<WH3824>.

And it shall be<WH7860>, when the officers have made an end<WH3615> of speaking<WH1696> unto the people<WH5971>, that they shall appoint<WH6485> captains<WH8269> of hosts<WH6635> at the head<WH7218> of the people<WH5971>.
When thou drawest nigh<WH7126> unto a city<WH5892> to fight<WH3898> against it<WH7121>, then proclaim peace unto it<WH7965>.

And it shall be<WH6030>, if it make thee answer of peace<WH7965>, and open<WH6605> unto thee<WH5971>, then it shall be, that all the people that are found<WH4672> therein shall become tributary<WH4522> unto thee<WH5647>, and shall serve thee.
And if it will make no peace<WH7999> with thee<WH6213>, but will make war<WH4421> against thee<WH6696>, then thou shalt besiege it:
and when Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> delivereth<WH5414> it into thy hand<WH3027>, thou shalt smite<WH5221> every male<WH2138> thereof with the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719>:

but the women<WH802>, and the little ones<WH2945>, and the cattle<WH929>, and all that is in the city<WH5892>, even all the spoil<WH7998> thereof<WH962>, shalt thou take for a prey unto thyself<WH398>; and thou shalt eat the spoil<WH7998> of thine enemies<WH341>, which Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath given thee<WH5414>.
Thus shalt thou do<WH6213> unto all the cities<WH5892> which are very<WH3966> far off<WH7350> from thee<WH2007>, which are not of the cities<WH5892> of these nations<WH1471>.
But of the cities<WH5892> of these peoples<WH5971>, that Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee for an inheritance<WH5159>, thou shalt save alive<WH2421> nothing that breatheth<WH5397>;

but thou shalt utterly<WH2763> destroy<WH2763> them<WH2850>: the Hittite, and the Amorite<WH567>, the Canaanite<WH3669>, and the Perizzite<WH6522>, the Hivite<WH2340>, and the Jebusite<WH2983>; as Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath commanded thee<WH6680>;

that they teach<WH3925> you not to do<WH6213> after all their abominations<WH8441>, which they have done<WH6213> unto their gods<WH430>; so would ye sin<WH2398> against Jehovah<WH3068> your God<WH430>.

When thou shalt besiege<WH6696> a city<WH5892> a long<WH7227> time<WH3117>, in making war<WH3898> against it to take<WH8610> it<WH7843>, thou shalt not destroy the trees<WH6086> thereof by wielding<WH5080> an axe<WH1631> against them<WH398>; for thou mayest eat of them<WH3772>, and thou shalt not cut them down; for is the tree<WH6086> of the field<WH7704> man<WH120>, that it should<WH935> be besieged of thee<WH6440>?

Only the trees<WH6086> of which thou knowest<WH3045> that they are not trees<WH6086> for food<WH3978>, thou shalt destroy<WH7843> and cut them down<WH3772>; and thou shalt build<WH1129> bulwarks<WH4692> against the city<WH5892> that maketh<WH6213> war<WH4421> with thee<WH3381>, until it fall.
